We may therefore admit it as probable that Tacitus was Propraetor of one of the Gallo-German provinceS, since he appears to have visited the country, and is not likely to have done so in a private capacity. His absence from Rome, probably from Italy, lasted at least four years; he was out of reach when his father-in-law died in August 93.
